p: Human parechoviruses are rapidly evolving picornaviruses that may cause sepsis-/meningitis-like illness in infants [ 1]. We have previously described three epidemic waves in Australia in 2013/14, 2015/16 and 2017/18 caused by a recombinant strain of human parechovirus type 3 (HPeV3) [ 2]. This strain of HPeV3 likely resulted from recombination of an HPeV3 Yamagata 2011 strain providing the capsid region and an unknown parechovirus providing the non-structural proteins region [ 3, 4].
